page.title: 12Wonersh
page.content: Wonersh is the nearest village to Bramley. Its main features are Barnett Hill and Lynes Farm. Barnett Hill is a unique treasure trove and was bought by F.Cook in 1905. He bought 26 acres of land and built a Queen Anne-style country house for Â£35000. The French tapestries and crystal chandeliers still remain there today. After the War the British Red Cross society turned the house into its National Training Centre. Lynes farm is owned by Commander Farley forming part of the 250 - 300 acres that he owns. The residents of Lynnes Farm grow barley and hay. There is a barn which dates back a long time and they are now building a cattery. In the middle of Wonersh is a square-roofed bus shelter called a pepperpot.
